website_summaries.verdict: Consolidate and manage your devices with a dock that prioritizes bandwidth usage.
pros: This dock supplies smooth, stable connections with a variety of devices
Includes 2 USB 3.0 ports, 4 USB 2.0 ports, 1 HDMI port, 1 DVI port, and an Ethernet port
HDMI and DVI ports can be used simultaneously, allowing you to expand your setup to 3 monitors
cons: Anker drivers may require multiple installations to recognize certain devices

customer_reviews.title: So my recommendation is Anker should have a forum or clarify so users can easily picked the right driver
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 4 star is because I had issue matching up the drivers for my Windows 10. Apparently, I found the driver on Anker site though Windows recently updated so the driver I pulled did not recognize the extended monitor feature so the HDMI did not work unless I plug in directly to my laptop. After I did some research I found took a guess and got the correct Windows 10 drive and it worked! So my recommendation is Anker should have a forum or clarify so users can easily picked the right driver. Otherwise, non-technical folks will probably return this product...
customer_reviews.author: Real_Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Designed to fail
customer_reviews.text: It started failing after several months. A friend of mine owned the same dock and his failed at exactly the same time. After disassembling and doing some testing, I found that 2 of the chips on the board get boiling hot under use and I wouldn't be surprised if they are cooking themselves to death. Also, the things that appear to be air vents on the top and bottom are completely blocked off. There is no airflow going through this dock, and appears to be engineered to fail. I won't ever buy another Anker product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Scott

customer_reviews.title: So nice!
customer_reviews.text: A few months ago my hub died. I have tried several different kinds of these over the last few months because my work paid for the last one and it was $300. I work partially from home so switching between work and home computers is a pain, especially with 2 monitors. All the others I tried either wouldn't work with both systems because my USB C port didn't support it, or the video would freak out on one system or the other. This one has a strange delay when switching systems and sometimes I have to plug it in a couple times, but it works every time. I missed having dual monitors for work.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Tingle

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, flexible
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a charm for setting up a home office for my work laptop. It's way more flexible than a dock specifically designed for any particular laptop, since you can easily set it up and use it for any laptop. I had absolutely no issues with getting it set up with 2 monitors, a headset, a wireless mouse, and a wireless keyboard. There were plenty of connections for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Ghostndragon

customer_reviews.title: Support Superior!
customer_reviews.text: My docking station stopped working. I emailed Anker support on a Saturday got an immediate response saying they would get back to me within 24 hrs. First thing Monday morning and there was an email from them with a number of things I should try. I looked through the list and picked out what I thought would be easiest for me, as a computer person I am not. I took everything attached to the docking station off and put them back on again. Low and behold it worked. Thank you Rankin for your help and getting back to me in a timely manner. Anker is the way too go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works on Mac OS Catalina, if you don't mind losing Night Shift capability
customer_reviews.text: After you install the DisplayLink drivers, it works on Mac OS Catalina, if you don't mind losing Night Shift capability. I work mostly at night and having Night Shift is very important for me. I tried contacting DisplayLink directly, and they basically said that it's unlikely to be added to the driver any time soon. The work-arounds I found online were gimmicky (changing color profiles manually). Otherwise, for regular web browsing and such it worked flawlessly, but I didn't try anything video intensive like video editing or gaming.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - Built to break in under a year
customer_reviews.text: Was always glitchy and laggy video, with two monitors, a printer, an external harddrive, the USB touch screen input for one of the monitors, and an USB webcam. After 10 months, it now has the USB connections for the webcam & printer functioning. The dock no longer recongizes any of the monitors. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the driver several times. Tried troubleshooting with different computers and HDMI cables. It appears that there was some sort of update, and I have not heard back from their technical service yet. TBC....
customer_reviews.author: Devon Mealey

customer_reviews.title: Windows update fixed the issue
customer_reviews.text: Update: issue was caused by windows update. Fixed now. Works great with 4 different laptops. I purchased this docking station in October 2015. It was working great. No issues with video, sound, or input devices. About a week ago I started noticing issues with video. Both video and mouse pointer would jerk every 2 seconds or so. Watching online video content from Netflix, Youtube and others has become annoying. I tried installing the latest DisplayLink drivers and Intel video drivers, but nothing seems to help. Bottom line, I'm unable to watch videos while docked. I tried with multiple computers with the same result. Now, waiting for response from Anker support.
customer_reviews.author: Odessit

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: This unit did not work at all for 16” MacBook Pro. I even bought a special USB 3 B to C cable to connect it. No matter what I tried, nothing connected to the dock ever showed up on my computer. I was attempting to connect two digital 1080p monitors. One over HDMI, the other over DVI. I also tried connecting headphones with the 3.5mm headphone jack. Nothing after several reboots and verifying all settings were correct. I returned the product and am looking for a new solution.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Muelver

customer_reviews.title: The set up for the docking station was easy as I was able to just plug and play
customer_reviews.text: I've recently became an Anker fan. Before purchasing this product, I was connecting two monitors: one via HDMI and another via a USB adapter. I also had my wireless mouse plugged in and external drive. I had all my USB ports taken up with my HDMI port. I bought this product in conjunction with their Anker 2.4GHz wireless keyboard and mouse combo. The set up for the docking station was easy as I was able to just plug and play. I was really looking for a solution that would allow me to plug in 1 USB to connect to all my devices. This product does the job! Very impressed so far with my Anker products!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works poorly with Mac
customer_reviews.text: From day one there were some minor problems such as windows moving after unlocking my laptop and certain windows displayed with lowered resolution. After a couple of weeks when I unlocked my laptop one or two of my monitors would not trim on. I would have to unplug the dock and plug it back in to get them to work. Most recently I've started getting kicked out to the login screen. I've opened a case with support but I would rather just send it back at this point.
customer_reviews.author: T. Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: This thing is GLITCHY
customer_reviews.text: This is ok when it actually works. I have had so many aggravating issues with this. It doesn't work all the time. Monitors go black, you have to switch plugs to get it to recognize things... NOT happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi Wild

customer_reviews.title: Good dock
customer_reviews.text: If you want to easily keep your desktop situation clean but still use a laptop, this is for you. It can also add additional monitors to your laptop. Great addition to any working from a laptop in an office environment.
customer_reviews.author: ITPro

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic USB 3.0 dock. Works great with Windows and MacOS.
customer_reviews.text: This works on a 2015 Retina MacBook Pro with very minimal issues. None of the issues experienced are due to the dock itself, but rather the third party MacOS USB display driver (DisplayLink). I have swapped this dock between both Windows and MacOS and al of my peripherals have worked flawlessly on both. My only complaint is the LED status light on the device is extremely bright, but a piece of a sticky note can solve this easily. :)
customer_reviews.author: Derek Cook

customer_reviews.title: Initially worked, then degraded
customer_reviews.text: Initially this worked as expected. Then over the months, one by one, the USB drives stopped working. Finally I reached out to customer support, who were very good and sent a replacement. Then the same thing happened with the replacement. Unfortunately, it's just too buggy and falls apart over time.
customer_reviews.author: Cheech

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this docking station at the end of July. It was easy to install and worked great. About six weeks later the product failed. I contacted Anker through Amazon. They asked me to try a couple of tests, but quickly determined that the docking station had indeed failed. During this process all emails were responded to within a few hours. They immediately sent a shipping label for the failed unit and also, very quickly shipped the replacement. This process cost me nothing and my new docking station works great. I believe the the true measure of a company is, when occasionally something goes wrong, how does the company respond. Anker gets 5 stars. I would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. Belles

customer_reviews.title: Convenient setup for using Mac with dual display
customer_reviews.text: This surely makes it easy for me to hook my Mac up to two monitors, USB keyboard, external speakers, and other USB devices. I like being able to just plug in one cable for all of that. One thing that I don't like is the animations, like minimizing windows, are slow and pixelated. I would not use this for things that require graphics performance like gaming, but I like it for normal computer usage and when coding which it is perfect for. My system: 13" Macbook Pro with Retina Display 2015 Logitech Keyboard Logitech Speakers Dual monitors (Asus 2k res) Apple Magic Mouse
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Does it all flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a Toshiba and a Dell laptop. I have a USB mouse and wireless keyboard and two huge monitors. The surround speakers are USB and sometimes I have wired and sometimes wireless connection. Whatever the configuration and programs, DVD playing and surfing, etc. the Anker is flawlessly delivering every device without hesitation or noticeable loss. Seems like a good product after a month of using it. I get the use of three monitors if you count the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bertrand

customer_reviews.title: Works well, beats buying a manufacturer specific dock.
customer_reviews.text: Periodically has input lag, but overall very pleased. Wish it had 2x hdmi instead of hdmi and DVI though. Works well with my Lenovo, HP, and Asus laptops.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: A terrible docking station
customer_reviews.text: This was a whopping waste of money. After downloading the drivers, per what other reviewers recommended, this Anker docking station is still a huge pain. I have to unplug and re-plug everything attached to it EVERY SINGLE TIME I use my work or personal laptops. And, it won't recognize my blue tooth mouse (despite it working directly on my personal and work laptops). Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ram

customer_reviews.title: Another great Anker product
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great docking station for my MacBook Pro. I originally purchased it hoping it would help me to conserve battery power with the large secondary monitor that I use with my computer. This has definitely made a difference. Getting it set up wasn't super easy, as I had to search around for quite a while to find the appropriate drivers so everything would work properly. I eventually got it figured out and it has worked great ever since. I would highly recommend this product for Apple users.
customer_reviews.author: browser.89

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Bang For The Buck Universal Docking Station with USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: So far this Universal Docking station has been good - no problems to date (in use for two weeks). Pros: * Easy to install (especially if you have had previous experience with docking stations; this is my third, I also own a Plugable USB 3.0 Dual Display (almost identical), and an older Toshiba USB 2.0); * Drivers updated with ease - using this on a LENOVO Laptop running WINDOWS 8.1; * Comes with both DVI and HDMI Display hookup (a plus when I upgrade to a HDMI Monitor); * Can't beat the price here on Amazon; Cons: * So far none; Highly recommended if you are in the market for a Universal Laptop Docking Station.
customer_reviews.author: cajunjake

customer_reviews.title: Better than Plugable UD-3900...but still utterly sucks under Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: It worked out better with Windows 10 ZenBook laptop than Plugable UD-3900 which was returned due to wireless keyboard delay issue and display problem when connected via DVI. Anker functioned perfectly right out of the box. Also prefer Anker's design and the fact that it can either be placed horizontally or vertically. -- Update 11/8/2016 Unfortunately, I have to rate it down due to constant issues with the sputtering keyboard/mouse and Ethernet interruptions. These must be DisplayLink driver issues. I was hoping they would get addressed but they have not been. At least not in the Windows 10 environment. Patience finally running out, getting rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Gennady Gandelman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - Best adapter for Macbaooks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for a Windows laptop, with which it works perfectly. Then I tried it with an old (2011) macbook air where it also works perfectly. This addresses a need I have had for connecting two external monitors to a macbook air. I was told that it is not possible to connect 2 monitors to a Macbook air, and another product I tried had failed. The Anker works flawlessly, and using only the USB port (not the thunderbolt port). Great product
customer_reviews.author: Raghav Singh

customer_reviews.title: ANKER products still not disappointing
customer_reviews.text: ANKER Docking Station Bought Nov2019 has been working great so far. Have two monitors, keyboard, mouse, external ssd, Usb headphones as well as speakers thru aux input into laptop. And dock has been performing fine. There have been two instances where the screens seemed to not initialize at startup of the laptop. A hard reset (unplug and replug) of the connection into laptop fixed issue immediately first time. 2nd time I experimented powering off and on the monitor and that will also resolve hiccup of monitors not responding immediately at startup.
customer_reviews.author: PollutedLives

customer_reviews.title: Great Dual Display Dock but use LATEST drivers or spend a lot of time fixing things...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you DON"T just plug it into your machine. It is NOT plug and play. You must first download the latest Display Link drivers. If your machine is slow or having odd video issues - you probably need to uninstall and start again. I ended up having to "restore" to a prior time to get things clean. My bad - I knew I should not have just plugged it in. Once I installed it correctly it was (is) great. THe resolution is as advertised. There is no lag on any of the screens I have connected.
customer_reviews.author: GoFigure

customer_reviews.title: Universal Product that works very, very well.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect with my Lenovo Yoga 2 Pro. The only thing I notice is for some reason when I throw Google Chrome on my external monitor, it may lag from time to time. Pretty sure it's a Chrome thing though. Everything else (including hefty programs like Photoshop) run very smoothly on my external displays. I have also purchased these for clients to dock Dell XPS 13 (2015), Surface Pro 3, and Surface Pro 4 devices. It works very well with very few (minor) hiccups. I strongly recommend this product for any device with USB3.0 that you'd like to dock. I only wish it supplied power via the dock as well, but that's coming in Thunderbolt 3.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: A solid buy.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, and haven't got anything from Anker that didn't seem to be pretty well thought out. Connected to Lenovo Yoga 700 with 2 Sceptre 27" monitors and a bunch of USB stuff. Setup relatively uneventful, but Windows 10 and Displaylink didn't play nice at first, then the next morning everything was fine. Fast throughput in everything I've done so far, small enough form factor to hide behind a monitor. Could it have more USB ports (4 USB 2.0, 2 USB 3.0)? Maybe. Otherwise, no buyer's remorse here.
customer_reviews.author: Left Handed Dataslave

customer_reviews.title: Decent product years later
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this product for about 2 years. Around March or April this year the dual monitor part stopped working. All of the other docking station features still worked. I had to connect my dual monitor directly to my laptop with a HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Hauschildt

customer_reviews.title: Does what said.
customer_reviews.text: Does most of what it said it would. It took very little effort to install. The trick is to update the DisplayLink drivers. I've got it connected to my Lenovo laptop's USB 3, HTML to my Samsung Monitor, Logitech mouse, keyboard and Webcam, and some other items, Windows 8.1 Pro. While it sometimes needs to be re-registered with the drivers by pulling the power on and off (would work better if it had a switch), that is the only significant issue (nuisance). Otherwise, I'm generally satisfied with cleaning up the disarray of wires and simplifying docking and undocking. I've had many other docking devices either from their respective computer manufacturers or third-party. This works just as well as any.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device, does exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.text: I know that Mac isn't technically supported with this but I bought it anyway for work where having more than one monitor is imperative. The device works great. I have had an issue with the LAN port, but I knew the device didn't support Mac when I got it and I just either connect wirelessly or I have a thunderbolt dongle for an RJ45. The audio has given me issue, but again, I can plug in directly to my laptop. Overall, exactly what I needed it for; this is like the 3rd~ish Anker product I have and I have not had a bad experience. Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't read ALL the information. :-( This does not support a. Mac dual monitors. Tech support was great. You have to plug in ALL the cables to make it work! lol! So much better, and smaller than my old docking station.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Forster

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a more generic docking station as I work from home frequently but also need to be able to connect our home laptop to the same equipment. Switching back and forth (even with a docking station for my work computer) was a pain. I bought a few Anker products as Christmas gifts and really loved them, so I figured this was a good investment. This docking station works great. It takes a minute or so after plugging it in for everything to start up, and it does better if you plug it in after the computer is up and running. But beyond that it works great. I will keep buying Anker products!
customer_reviews.author: Christine M. Dohm

customer_reviews.title: Fast setup and very reliable -- Issues with Windows 10 + 4k display
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I had my whole setup up and working within 15 minutes. I am using a laptop with two external monitors. There have been some issues with Windows 10 using a 4k display. My laptop has a 4k display but my extended monitors are 1080p. So I learned that if you connect the docking station AFTER windows has booted, everything will be jacked up, even if I adjust the resolution. I have to reboot windows after adjusting the resolution for everything to look right. However, this seems to be more of a Windows 10 issue and not an issue with the docking station
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Afana

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with ultra-wide monitors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before checking the specs and wanted to let people know that the docking station doesn't work with ultra-wide monitors since its resolution is limited. I previously had a USB hub which is much cheaper. Since I can't use my ultra wide, it essentially made this an expensive USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: P. G Lee

customer_reviews.title: Hdmi wouldnt work with mac
customer_reviews.text: Should be specified in the specifications that nothings works for mac except for usb. I have a very good opinion about anker but this one totally disappointed. My intention of purchasing this is to connect my 2 monitors with my macbook. But the hdmi is now working. It was specified on the support website that execpt usb nothing works with mac, then why would I buy this, for USBs, soooo disaapponted..
customer_reviews.author: venkata nagireddi

customer_reviews.title: 1/5 star
customer_reviews.text: Second monitor display with MacBook lags out and freezes. The USB 3.0 ports do not even charge my devices, such as iPhone and headphones. Very disappointed with the poor performance and functionality of this Anker device. I expected better based on prior products.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Zhouk

customer_reviews.title: Could not get this to work on Surface Pro 3
customer_reviews.text: Not giving this one star because it works for some people. It seemed to work brilliantly at first but as I went on and off the docking station over a few days the touchscreen on my surface began to freak out as If I was touching the edge, clicking icons and opening programs by itself. I think it was the displaylink software, which has a great reputation, btw. I tried upgrading to the latest version of displaylink and deleting and reinstalling touchscreen drivers, calibrating, but it didn't help. I'm going to spend more for the Microsoft docking station. This could work fine for you, it just didn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dale H.

customer_reviews.title: Not supported by Win10 out of the box and is causing my laptop to freeze and reboot randomly even with the new drivers.
customer_reviews.text: Not supported by Win10 out of the box and had to download updated drivers to make it work at all. Additionally, the available drivers are now causing my Gateway NV50A laptop to spontaneously freeze and reboot several times a day which never happened before. Granted the NV50A is no screamer, but with 8gb of ram and a SSD it should be more than sufficient. This dock is now several years old and while it is great that they published new drivers i just wish they did a better job at it. This is going back to amazon for a refund and will start looking for something newer and designed for Win10 support.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B Keen

customer_reviews.title: Will continue to purchase their products so far they have been great.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to power a few additional monitors off my laptop for work. The original one I got had a quirk with the USB ports. Contacted Anker and they sent me a new one right away allowing me to keep the one I currently have until the replacement arrived. Have many other Anker products around the house and office. Will continue to purchase their products so far they have been great.
customer_reviews.author: GaltsGulch

customer_reviews.title: Good until I upgraded Macbooks
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this hub for a few months. I use this to connect 2 monitors/keyboard/mouse/headphones. It worked well with my previous macbook pro. After upgrading to the latest Macbook Pro, the audio form the headphones cuts out (for 20-30 seconds) a few times a day, which is pretty annoying. I'll update this if we find a way to fix it, but I'm having trouble getting a response from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I plugged it in and turned it on and it worked with no additional setup.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Plugable USB C dock that worked intermittently at best and then finally quit last week. This dock was cheaper than a comparable USB C dock, and I had an available USB C to USB 3.0 adapter so I figured I would give it a shot. I plugged everything in and turned on my computer and it worked. Specifically, it defaulted to the monitor configuration I had set up previously for my Plugable dock without even a single mouse click. I will post a follow up if my enthusiasm is short lived due to reliability issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H.

customer_reviews.title: Very good, just don't use for mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I use it to drive 2 24'' monitors, speakers and keyboard for my work setup at home. Four stars because running a mouse through this is extremely laggy. I had to put the USB receiver in the laptop instead of the dock. Not a huge issue, but it is something that should work better.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Starting to Fail
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 of these. the USB 3.0 doesn't provide power to devices. Recently, 1 of my docking stations has started failing resulting in the network connection to say i'm connected, yet i can't load any websites. additionally, my built-in bluetooth stops functioning correctly It requires me disconnecting the docking station and/or restarting to get my computer working normally
customer_reviews.author: Vishal Doddanna

customer_reviews.title: USB 3.0 ports are off and on
customer_reviews.text: Update to review. Very good customer service. They contacted me and offered to replace if defective. But they told me that only the bottom USB 3.0 port is recommended for charging. Once I changed it around so the charging was on the right port it has been working. Had this for 2 months. It was difficult to get the video going until I found the updated driver. But the USB 3.0 charging ports are a bit flaky. Sometimes they work and sometimes they don't? right now only 1 or the 2 are working.
customer_reviews.author: Winghead

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Read instructions before install!!!
customer_reviews.text: Follow the Instructions... Wait, It didn't come with any... It came with a leaflet that said "installation instructions" but there was just a diagram of the unit on it and warranty info. I did find on the Anker website the full instructions, do as it asks and don't just plug it in like I did. I had to delete the partially installed drivers as I was too eager to get it plugged in. All works now and works well, I use it for my Asus Laptop with an external display, all my connected drives and keyboard and mouse. No issues with speed or responsiveness. I do not have any USB 3.0 devices but both it and my laptop are capable.
customer_reviews.author: aBull

customer_reviews.title: Works reliably out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This device earned my 5 stars just by being more reliable than the Targus USB 3.0 Dual Display Universal Docking station. We purchased about 20 of the Targus a year and a half ago. We started having trouble within a month. Their customer service ran us in circles of updating drivers and firmware and refused to provide an RMA. Contrast that with Anker who tracks down customers if they even post trouble in a review. Now as each of the other brand dies (I'm up to 5 now), I replace it with an Anker. I don't even have to help the users, it is that simple if you've already been using a DisplayPort device.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Let's you display your laptop screen on an external monitor and extend your desktop to a second monitor, pretty much all you could ask for. Keyboard and mouse work fine as well as sound.
customer_reviews.author: Vrooom

customer_reviews.title: Good, but test all the ports as soon as you get it.
customer_reviews.text: Really great product... but my major complaint is that I think one of my ports is boarder line broken? My DVI cable port turns the monitor attached to it a hue of blue if touched and it has to be fiddled with every time I bump my desk. I don't know if I just got a damaged model or what. I have tried multiple cables and adapters to test, but no matter what if you jiggle the cable it pops in and out of the proper colors. I wonder if I'm past the date to return for a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Ron B

customer_reviews.title: Product was missing the USB3 cable
customer_reviews.text: Product was missing the USB 3 cable that actually connects it to your laptop. The product description states that it comes with it. Product also arrived covered in some sort of lemon oil on the inside of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Zil

customer_reviews.title: this dock is perfect. The price is right and it does not ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased multiple of these exact devices in the past for my employer and now I finally had a need for one at my home. I have this installed on multiple laptops at home, both Windows 7 and Windows 10. Both installs went smooth and without any issues. The only thing I wish it has was built in bluetooth so my Logitech mouse and keyboard can auto connect to any laptop plugged into the dock. Otherwise, this dock is perfect. The price is right and it does not take up any room on my desk like most docks tend to do. I will definitely buy more of these when the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Berard

customer_reviews.title: Works well with plenty of ports.
customer_reviews.text: USB dock was plug-and-play ready. No additional drivers/software were needed. Included stand works nicely, or you can lay it flat. Copying files, video quality, network speed all seem to be good. 1. Would be great if they could incorporate a power switch for connected devices as well as for the hub. 2. Wireless mouse is a bit jumpy at times. Proximity to usb receiver, plugged into hub, doesn't seem to have any impact.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with my other docking station (by Plugable). The Plugable unit would disconnect all my peripherals constantly. I wasn't sure if replacing it would take care of the problem, and yet the purchase of the Anker unit immediately eliminated all problems. I believe static electricity was disconnecting the other unit, and when I hooked up the Anker unit (which was very easy to do), all static problems went away. The Anker unit has a nice stand that is removeable and the unit sits on a small desk and takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: muggleone

customer_reviews.title: A product and support you can trust
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and product support. I am using this docking station to support two 32 inch LCD Sony TV screens that I use as monitors. One is HDMI, the other DVI. Using an HP Spectre X360 i7, 8g RAM Intel HD 5500 video processor. Does an excellent job. Found I had best results with DisplayFusion software instead of the windows 8.1 stock app. Had issues with cursor movement and was skillfully aided by David at Anker. I called and left my number, he called back within 10 minutes. Recommend product and company. USB 3 can certainly carry a lot of data.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bolton

customer_reviews.title: If you are not going to use the DVI connection you should buy this...updated review, this works now and Anker rocks!
customer_reviews.text: The DVI connection would not work. Other than that issue this would have been a perfect addition to my setup. I take my laptop with me every now and then and I do not like having to unplug 6 different cables every time. I probably would start taking my laptop to the living on the regular if this had worked. If you do not intend to use the DVI connection then you should definitely get this product. Update 2/25/2016: Anker has so graciously sent me a free replacement (even though I sent this item back a while ago). This new unit work as expected. I cannot say enough good things about Anker!
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: ... Dell D3000 model at my office (300-400 employees) w/ good luck. But
customer_reviews.text: I was originally going to purchase a Dell D3100 docking station as we use the Dell D3000 model at my office (300-400 employees) w/ good luck. But, I've had great luck w/ Anker products and for $20 less so I figure what the heck and give it shot. I just have my Microsoft Surface Pro tablet, an LED LCD monitor (LG), and an Ethernet cable connected to my AT&T U-Verse router and it's been working great so far. I went on DisplayLink's website for the drivers and didn't bother w/ the supplied CD.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband. Worked pretty well until for a bit until something went wrong with one of the cables that came with it and kept disconnecting.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, only gave a 4 because sometimes when I re-boot my computer I do have to unplug and re-plug in this device (docking station) and you shouldn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonPrime User

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought my 4th Anker docking station for the office (replacing old Dell units) and its been a great product. I am using this with a Lenovo Ideapad, a 2in1, and 2 dell XPS 13 laptops. All systems are now running Windows 10 and no additional software was needed to make them work properly. Just plug in and give it 5-10 minutes to install and update drivers and maybe reboot the computer and you are good to go. If this thing only worked with Mac it would make my life a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little pricy but works better than I expected. The network port on the unit stopped working after a couple of weeks and Anker replaced without questions, so I assume this is a known problem. They wanted me to return the defective unit first meaning I could only use my laptop directly, but when I protested they relented and sent me a new one first, so good marks for that in the end. Occasionally the driver/unit gets confused and thinks there are 3 instead of 2 monitors connected - either rebooting my laptop or power cycling the unit fixes it. Overall I can recommend this unit - not perfect but pretty darn good.
customer_reviews.author: Russell M.

customer_reviews.title: and makes the whole setup useless..
customer_reviews.text: It works with windows 10 but it was pain to setup. DO NOT PLUG IT IN OUT OF THE BOX. Get the Windows 10 drivers from the Anker website. Run the installer and follow the directions on screen. After reboot it probably won't work. Go to device manager, find the USB Display Adapter and have windows search for an updated driver... It should then work. The drivers from Display Link (7.9M4, at the time of writing this) cause the display to continuously reset.. and makes the whole setup useless...
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my brothers computer, he loves it, never knew anything existed. Got this 1/14/19, and today is 2/5/19, so far so good. First days the audio wasn't working but we just took the wires out and and inserted back in - it was fine. No other problems since then. Definitely recommend to keep computer area less cluttered with wires.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect working device
customer_reviews.text: This is a great genetic docking station. I have used it across multiple different manufacturers of laptops and the have all worked great. Have purchased several more of them for other workers in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Fidler

customer_reviews.title: This docking station is horrible
customer_reviews.text: If I reboot my computer, I have to mess with the docking station to get my monitors working again. It usually takes 5 or so minutes to get everything working. Sometimes, everything locks up...the mouse and keyboard won't work and the screens are blurred. Every time I undock my computer, I have problems getting everything working again. I have purchased items from Anker before with good success, but this thing is just a royal pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play on a Lenovo Yoga
customer_reviews.text: This was "plug and play" on a Lenovo Yoga with Windows 8.1. We had absolutely no problem getting it started up. Dual 1080p displays, Ethernet, mouse, keyboard, and sound all worked simultaneously over the single USB3 connection. Ethernet speed was not tested to see how close to 1Gbps could be achieved while simultaneously driving the displays, but browsing and HD video streaming worked fine over the link.
customer_reviews.author: jlb

customer_reviews.title: Works great but get most recent drivers.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything Anker. This works great, but pay attention as the two video ports are one HDMI and one DVI. You will probably need to buy some cables or adapters to connect two monitors. And then make sure you go to DisplayLink website and download the most recent driver package. Install the drivers BEFORE connecting the dock. Without the right drivers, you will think the dock is worthless. DisplayLink regularly releases driver updates to keep pace with new equipment and operating systems.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cope

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as expected, couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: This port extender works exactly as it should. Installation couldn't be simpler, didn't have to load any drivers for a Microsoft Surface Pro 3 running Windows 10. Monitor (HDMI) comes on when plugged in (and local screen off), and reverts back to local display when undocked. External keyboard and mouse work just fine. Have already recommended it to others! Of course, it doesn't supply power to the laptop, you'll need to connect your laptop power supply also if you want it to charge. Not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Shamblin

customer_reviews.title: Everything works just like it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these Anker Docking Station for a couple of years now and just purchased my third one. I have used them with Win 7, 8.1 and now Win 10. I use them with ASUS T100 Transformer book and TP200 Flipbook ultra-portable computers to add keyboard and mouse, two 24" displays, additional USB3.0 ports and wired Gigabit Ethernet. Everything works just like it's supposed to! You don't see that everyday! I have used other Anker products: USB 3.0 hub and micro hub and external rechargeable power source and can recommend them all. The one time I needed service, Anker was prompt and handled everything to my complete satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: T Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these docking stations, one for my office and the other for home, because I have had trouble with the USB ports giving out on more than one computer. The docking station is a super easy set up...plug and play...absolutely nothing else to it for me! I'm looking forward to being able to use my new computer for a long time without port problems with this new docking station. I would definitely recommend for anyone who has multiple items they are plugging and unplugging daily from their computer.
customer_reviews.author: pkoch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, Easy to use, small design, Great product
customer_reviews.text: I'm not tech saavy what so ever, so I was really impressed I got this set up without having to google something. I didn't have to download any drivers for my Windows 8 PC, but ended up having to download the software from the website for my Windows 7 PC. I got this so I could set up extended monitors which works perfectly. I switch between my work computer and home computer quite frequently, before I would have to unplug everything from one computer and re-plug the monitors etc. It was a hassle. Now I just have to unplug one USB cord and it's done.
customer_reviews.author: Bex

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly just like other Anker products
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly just like other Anker products. I purchased this to split the video on my desktop; works with my notebook as well so when I want to use my notebook; I can simply plug into the USB and then use my home monitors. As far as my desktop; worked perfectly with Windows 10; as soon as I plugged in the unit activated Displaylink; the only thing I had to do was to arrange the order of the monitors now I have three; have option for one more from desktop that I disabled for now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Ring, CPA

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with Mac OS X Yosemite.
customer_reviews.text: works very well with my McBook Pro Retina (late 2013) Updated: works indeed well but not top speed performance for graphic display. Should be OK if you just do office work with your Mac though. I completed my setup with 2 belkin thunderbolt-to-hdmi converter and I'm now just using the Anker docking station for ethernet/USB connections.
customer_reviews.author: Adrien C

customer_reviews.title: A perfect companion for my Yoga 2
customer_reviews.text: OK, so having a really cool ultrabook has its advantages, but connectivity is often not one of them. One of the ways they keep it small is by not putting many holes to plug into, but sometimes you need those holes. This fixes that, the video works flawlessly, and you get a bunch of USB connections. Admittedly, the USB connections are a hub, and some stuff doesn't like to be plugged into a hub, but I have never found a way around that. This is small, lightweight, and works well. 'nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: tehuti

customer_reviews.title: Great feature set, build quality, and packaging.
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a a bad Anker product, and this is no exception. Plugs in, is recognized, and works exactly as specified. Great dock for my tablet when I want to do some more serious work at home. Packed very well and at a reasonable price for the feature set provided. Much cheaper than regular laptop dock, but provides all the typical features other than charging. Now that these are USB 3.0, bandwidth for all the features is less of a concern across one USB cable.
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Mcgregor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service!!!
customer_reviews.text: While I have not yet had a chance to actually use this product, I am giving this product 5 stars for the awesome Anker customer service. The product arrived on time a few days ago, and in the few minutes it took me to set up all the parts, my foster dog decided to stealthily chew the power adapter cord...into two pieces. Needless to say, this is why I have not yet tried the product. I called Anker with my frustrating story, and they are shipping out a replacement adapter cord now, free of charge! I will update my review again once I get to using the product, but this alone gets FIVE STARS! Thank you, Anker!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be great to have more than one port for monitors and ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered promptly and packaged well. Works perfectly for my work at home needs. Would be great to have more than one port for monitors and to space the ports further apart so the connections fit without having to squeeze between each other. I did have a problem that was hard for me to trouble shoot, but it turned out to be a faulty USB port on my laptop and not the docking station itself. Customer service was very responsive when I thought my trouble was from the product itself. Overall, very satisfied with the product and the service received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great, Until It Didn't.
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this for my ASUS all-in-one. I got 3 screens to work with, which was really nice for the type of work that I do. It was very smooth, responsive, no lag. The internet speed is degraded, but that is to be expected. I still got great speed connecting through the USB port. Just as I was bragging about this device to a coworker, it died. It won't power up at all. I work from home full-time, so it was on 24/7. Still, I expected it to last more than 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: DSolisATX

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! My Anker mice and keyboards have been excellent quality for affordable prices thus far, so I took a chance on this docking station and it paid off! My previous USB hub made weird high-pitched noises when I plugged in certain devices. This hub is a little on the pricy side, but it routes the USB devices and audio perfectly. I haven't tried routing my video through it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Docking Station
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Dell XPS 18 and needed a docking station so that I could use it as my desktop. This unit provides excellent access for purposes of dual port video (my other monitor is a 1920x1200) and it does the dual video great. Window's 8.1 has touch screen issues with dual screen - FYI - but I don't use the touch screen when I'm using my Dell as a desktop. The Anker also does a great job for the audio - keyboard etc - and has lots of high speed ports. And it downloads it's own new software updates automatically - sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meets/Exceeds Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in. Installed the software from the DisplayLink website. Works like a charm! I am using four of the USB ports, the audio port, the Ethernet port, and the DVI Out port. I have a Windows 10 desktop. The video out exceeds my expectations based on some of the reviews I read before purchasing. I thought I'd only be able to use it for document processing or things without much movement, but it is absolutely clear and smooth with video as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's been a great solution for sharing a desk in a mixed (Mac ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works well! I even use a Mac running Yosemite with the beta DisplayLink Driver. My only gripe would be that Mission Control and switching between desktops is not as smooth as you would expect for a Mac. The the delay is still tolerable, though. Everytime I plug in all of the peripherals are recognized without issue. It's been a great solution for sharing a desk in a mixed (Mac Windows) environment. I have bought both this one and the Pluggable UD3000. The Anker has a better appearance and build quality. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: updated: great product.  Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave the product a three-star review because I had some technical issues. I was immediately contacted by tech support who wanted to help. They quickly shipped me a replacement -- just in case. Ultimately, we were able to diagnose the issue to one of the peripherals (an external hard disk) which was plugged into the device . Moving that particular device from a USB 2.0 to a USB 3.0 plug solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ogen

customer_reviews.title: Product works as advertised. I use it in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised. I use it in my office. Issue described below is not critical if TL;DR is followed. TL;DR- Dont put your laptop to sleep with the dock connected and then disconnect, will blue screen the machine. Potential issue to be aware of with DisplayLink drivers: Putting the laptop into sleep mode with the dock connected and then disconnecting the dock and waking the laptop will result in a bluescreen and subsequent "No Boot Media" PXE message after restart. Issue resolves by pressing reset button on the bottom of my laptop (Acer-P645 ; TravelMate P), YMMV (Your mileage may vary). Issue does not occur if laptop is put to sleep without the dock connected.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hinerman

customer_reviews.title: The unit worked quickly and well with one exception. ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked quickly and well with one exception. For some reason the external speakers don't work when plugged into the docking station. I have to plug them directly into the computer to avoid having to use the weak internal speakers. Avoiding individual plug-ins is the main reason for a docking station, so it's disappointing that it doesn't work for that item. All the other peripherals do seem to work when plugged into the docking station. UPDATE: The seller sent a survey and I noted this problem. I quickly got a reply suggesting a change in my computer's sound setting. That cured the problem. With that correction and good service, I changed the rating from three to five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love that the base is removable. I'm running a triple monitor setup now....Laptop screen... plus two Dell 20" monitors! I have one monitor setup as DVI to DVI and the second monitor is setup as HDMI to HDMI. The USB ports on my monitors require me to run cables to the doc for them to work. Plenty of ports left over for a phone charger, external USB device, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Arkady

customer_reviews.title: Great product, no issues at all
customer_reviews.text: Great product, no issues at all. Very cool, sleek design. One tip; if you are docking a laptop and you want to put it to sleep without having to open and close it, you will want to wake the device from the external mouse buttons. This seems to only work when the mouse is plugged into the USB 3 jack in the front, not from the USB 2 jacks in the back of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Needed a dual monitor set up and this worked out for me. Instructions aren't the most detailed but if you are halfway knowledgeable about basic tech stuff you'll be able to figure it out. I had to purchase a couple adapters to make this work so make sure you check the compatibility on your devices before purchasing. Once set up properly. Worked like a charm. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J.S

customer_reviews.title: Crap!  DVI port worked intermittently for a little while, then not at all - UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Crap. The DVI-D port worked intermittently at first. I tried two different cables. Still worked mostly, but not always. Now that the return period has expired it does not work at all. Don't buy this one. UPDATE: I called Anker support. They were very helpful. Suggested a few things to try, but those did not work. So they emailed me a prepaid mailing label to return the unit, and shipped me a new one which came with a few days. That one seems to be fine. So i have updated my rating. They stood behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fried

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for a friend and it just didn't function like it was supposed to for us
customer_reviews.text: Worked when it decided to work. Bought this for a friend and it just didn't function like it was supposed to for us. Every time they booted up, they weren't sure if everything was going to connect. They had a printer, keyboard, mouse and external drive to dock with and it wouldn't always connect. Sometimes nothing would connect. Other times just the keyboard and mouse would. Your mileage may vary, it didn't work for us though.
customer_reviews.author: In Due Time

customer_reviews.title: Works great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in and it worked immediately and flawlessly with Windows 10 pro. Dual monitors, ethernet, usb, all without a glitch.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Poor support drivers wise dating back to Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: Poor support drivers wise dating back to Windows 8, not exclusively a Windows 10 problem. The agent program sometimes goes nuts for no apart reason and takes up 25% CPU. Kill the process and everything is fine, it's not like anything goes wrong so what was it doing at the time? Frequently crashes and requires a restart by plugging and unplugging. Often shows the displays in a blurry / hazy resolution like it's scaled wrong and requires a restart. USB ports stop working for a couple of days then eventually come back.
customer_reviews.author: Ding dong

customer_reviews.title: Frequently Doesn't Connect
customer_reviews.text: On every reboot, it's a toss-up if my screen, mouse, or keyboard will connect. Definitely not "plug-and-play" I love Anker products and have keyboards, mice, chargers, and speakers, but the docking stations need a lot of work.
customer_reviews.author: Sandesh Shettar

customer_reviews.title: Better (and cheaper) that the big name brands!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a couple of other of these USB 3 docking stations for my Lenovo Yoga. This one by far is the best...and costs much less than the other devices I have used. As soon as I plugged it into the USB port of my laptop...all devices were recognized...and the monitor popped right on. In the past, the other docking stations that I used sometimes wouldn't connect to my HDMI monitor, so I would have to power cycle the docking station. Not this one...as soon as the computer wakes, the monitor pops on. Everything else works as advertised. Great little device.
customer_reviews.author: groove_e1

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this dock to anyone looking for a multiple screen ...
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with ease of setup regarding this dock. My Surface Pro 4 connected and installed needed drivers. My old dock at times would not see monitors but i have been impressed that each and everytime i boot have not had to reset anything to get all my devices and monitors working. I would recommend this dock to anyone looking for a multiple screen solution for laptop or tablet.
customer_reviews.author: TC Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great docking station!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best docking stations I've used! I have used two other docking stations at my work and neither of them are nearly as good as this one. It is made very sturdy and stands up very well with the included stand. Installation was a breeze and makes hooking up my multiple computers to all of my peripherals very simple. I haven't noticed any screen flicker like you do sometimes with docking stations like this and it supports my 24" monitor with no problem. For the general computer working I've done using it, I haven't had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic product. Set up was a breeze
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. Set up was a breeze. I'm using a 2016 Acer laptop running Windows 10. I've got two large monitors, an external keyboard and two external mice that I use. I actually never got around to installing the included software. I was able to configure the monitors to extend (not duplicate). This docking station uses a single USB 3 plug to handle all the peripherals. Looks great, works great, couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Ory

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Anker device. I use each one with 2 Dell flatscreens, a couple of external hard drives, and a wireless keyboard and mouse. I connect a Surface Pro 2 (LOVE the Surface Pro!), Dell laptop and HP laptop. There were some software issues with the first Anker device I bought, but that was over a year ago. With this new one it has been a completely seemless experience. It's all just plug and play. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: Antonomasia

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up and solved my problem!
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling to find a docking station for an older Lenovo Ideapad 320. After buying and returning a couple, this one really came through. The monitor resolution is great and response on all devices fast.
customer_reviews.author: SharonT

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit on the recommendation of William Warner for an HP Pavilion Notebook laptop with Windows 10, so I can use USB-wired external keyboard and mouse + two external monitors. One monitor uses HDMI cable and the other uses DVI cable. Also have a printer plugged into USB port in the rear, with one more port remaining. Then there's two more USB 3.0 ports in the front of the unit also available. I downloaded the applicable driver and I've had no problems whatsoever, worked out as good as I had hoped and expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This may be a good product but it's not rated to work with windows ...
customer_reviews.text: This may be a good product but it's not rated to work with windows 10 and I have had no luck with it. I ended up just buying a good USB hub. The reason I'm giving it a 3 is the possibility that there is an update or something I'm missing. It has been useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Anker Dual Display Universal Docking Station with DVI/HDMI Output, Audio, Gigabit Ethernet, 2 USB 3.0 ports, 4 USB 2.0 Ports, and 38W Adapter for Monitor, Sound, PC, Mac and Other Devices
product_meta.description:
Take control of your workspace. With the Anker USB 3.0 Docking Station, coordination has never been easier: route your peripherals through one device, so you can come and go as you please.

Work at the helm.
The mother of all hubs. Bring your printers, scanners, storage devices, monitors, speakers, routers, keyboards, mice, and webcams together, so that all you have to do is worry about one cable. Turn your laptop into a command center, then, once you're finished, unplug for instant portability. Our promise to you is convenience - how you use it is up to you.

A multitasker's dream.
Add up to two monitors, expanding your control over active applications. High-resolution displays (both HDMI and DVI) will change the way you stream video, surf the web, and manage operation. Perfect for traders, gamers, and business professionals, but adaptable for use in any environment. Don't confine yourself to one screen. Go out and expand your horizons.

Dynamic design.
Not only does this docking station consolidate your devices, it manages their performance, too. A smart chip prioritizes bandwidth usage, so even when running at full capacity, you get smooth, stable connections. With a sturdy, zinc-alloy base stand, the docking station slips easily into any upright space. If one is not available, remove the stand for even tighter, horizontal placement.

Note:
• If you encounter compatibility problems with your current driver, please go to the official Displaylink website to download the latest driver.
• 2.4Ghz wireless devices (keyboards, mice, etc.) may not work around USB 3.0 ports. Try using a USB 2.0 connection.
feature_bullets: Consolidate devices and connect to all of your peripherals at once via a single USB 3.0 cable. Supports Windows 10, 8.1, 8, 7, & legacy XP systems. Latest software for Mac, Android, Ubuntu on official DisplayLink website.
Supports simultaneous HDMI and DVI displays, allowing you to expand your desktop to three monitors. Ethernet port supports 10 / 100 / 1000Mbps speeds.
Automatic bandwidth prioritization of connected devices ensures smooth, stable operation, even when every port is full.
Two USB 3.0 ports (one of which can charge at 5V / 1.5A) give you access to SuperSpeed data transfer rates of up to 5Gbps. Four USB 2.0 ports also available.
Package includes: Anker USB 3.0 Docking Station, detachable base stand, 19V 2A AC power adapter, USB 3.0 cable, driver CD, user manual, quick installation guide.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,089 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
